724387f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Beach Street
724387f-a.text:
(1)
West Broadway, At, and adjoining the N.W. corner of Beach Street.
Also shown is Beach Street, north side, west from West Broadway, to,
but not including Varick Street. The Sixth Ave., Elevated is seen
on West Broadway, across the clearance at the N.E. corner of Walker
Street.
October 19, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
October 19, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg 9 977
724387f-a.folder: West Broadway & Beach Street, Manhattan, NY

709243f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Lispenard Street
709243f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, north from Lispenard Street. The open area seen
is at Canal Street. Buildings to the right are No's. 1 and 3 Lis-
penard Street, same being opposite the New York Telephone Company
building and where the photographer is standing.
July 12, 1939
P. L. Snerr

716616f-b.title: Manhattan: Beach Street - West Broadway
716616f-b.text:
Beach Street, west from West Broadway, showing details
of this locale after the removal of the old Sixth Avenue
IEl'. The triangular perk in the foreground lies between
West Broadway and Varick Street. Beyond is the open space
where the former St. Johns Park Freight Terminal stood.
The buildings opened to view are on the west side of Hudson
Street. Views 2 and 3 are from the extension of Sixth Ave.
The last details solely the American Thread Co. Bldg.
July 12, 1939
No's. 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr
716616f-b.folder: Beach Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724390f-b.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - 6th Avenue
724390f-b.text:
West Broadway (right) and Sixth Avenue (left),
north from Lispenard Street, showing prominently the
triangular plot at this convergence. Forming the far
side of same is Canal Street. North of this main cross-
town thoroughfare appears St. Alphonsus R. C. Church.
View 1: March 19,1939
View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr

724390f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - 6th Avenue
724390f-a.text:
West Broadway (right) and Sixth Avenue (left),
north from Lispenard Street, showing prominently the

View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr

724388f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Beach Street
724388f-a.text:
West Broadway, west side, south from Beach Street,
to show in the background the outstanding Western Union
Building.Obscuring a portion of same is the Shuttleworth
Building (formerly the Comet Warehouse) at Finn Square.
To the right of center is North Moore Street with low
buildings at its North Westerly and South Westerly corners.
July 12, 1939
P. L. Sperr
724388f-a.folder: West Broadway & Beach Street, Manhattan, NY

724391f-b.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Lispenard Street
724391f-b.text:
West Broadway, north from Lispenard Street,
showing this thorou hfare subsequent to the de-
molition of the Sixth Avenue 'E1" line.
To the right are 3-story buildings at
the N.E. corner of L;spenard Street. Running
diagonally across the foreground is the Sixth
Avenue Extension and from which the photographer
is viewing. Canal Street is behind the gas station
at the triangular plot formed by the convergence
of Sixth Avenue and West Broadway. Upon the west
side of the latter and north of Canal Street is
St Alphonsus R.C. Church.
Note in the distance the vague outlines
of the Empire State Building and the distinctive
apartment structure, No. 1 Fifth Avenue.
July 12, 1939
P. L. Sperr
724391f-b.folder: West Broadway & Lispenard Street, Manhattan, NY

724386f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Walker Street
724386f-a.text:
West Broadway, east side. south from
Aalker Street. At the left is Sixth Avenue South,
an extension that runs to Church Street and upon
which are the several buildings shown.
View 2 is limited, confining itself to
the foreground structures. The photographer views
same in an eastward direction along North Moore
Street. Bayond these lofts is the Sixth Avenue
and Church Street convergence and at the apex of
which is the partially seen New York Telephone
Building.
May 19, 1939
Views 1, 2
P. L. Sperr
724386f-a.folder: West Broadway & Walker Street, Manhattan, NY

723814f-a.title: Manhattan: Walker Street - West Broadway
723814f-a.text:
2-8 Walker Street, on the N.E. corner of West Broadway.
October 10, 1928,
P. L. Sperr.
No Reproductions.
723814f-a.folder: Walker Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724389f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Beach Street
724389f-a.text:
(I)
West Broadway,West Side,North from but not including Beach Street,to
and including Grand Street.
Lispenard Street is also shown on the right,at,adjoining and East of
the North East corner of West Broadway.  TVe view also includes
Canal Street,(in the background),North Side,West from. and including
West Broadway,to and including Thomsson Street.
g ~i76
October Ist,I928
(2)
The same from a different angle.
October IOth,I928
Photographs by,
P.L.Sperr,
No Reproductions.

724392f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Lispenard Street
724392f-a.text:
West Broadway, st Lispenard Street between Cenal and Wetker Streets.,
looking south.
P. L. Sperr  July 12, 1939
